citeinfo.origin: University of Hawaii Dept. of Urban and Regional Planning
citeinfo.title: Cables

pubinfo.publish: University of Hawaii Dept. of Urban and Regional Planning
Coastal Zone Management Hawaii; Hawaii State GIS Program

descript.abstract: Submarine cables located in marine waters within the vicinity of the main Hawaiian Islands and recorded on the nautical charts. Source, NOAA raster nautical charts, 2002. For additional information, please refer to metadata at http://files.hawaii.gov/dbedt/op/gis/data/cables.pdf or contact Hawaii Statewide GIS Program, Office of Planning, State of Hawaii; PO Box 2359, Honolulu, Hi. 96804; (808) 587-2846; email: gis@hawaii.gov; Website: http://planning.hawaii.gov/gis.
descript.purpose: Submarine cables located in marine waters within the vicinity of the main Hawaiian Islands and recorded on the nautical charts. Source, NOAA raster nautical charts, 2002. For additional information, please refer to metadata at http://files.hawaii.gov/dbedt/op/gis/data/cables.pdf or contact Hawaii Statewide GIS Program, Office of Planning, State of Hawaii; PO Box 2359, Honolulu, Hi. 96804; (808) 587-2846; email: gis@hawaii.gov; Website: http://planning.hawaii.gov/gis.

idinfo.useconst: Data not to be used for navigational purposes. Data were not reviewed or authenticated by the Office of Coast Survey, NOAA National Ocean Service. NOAA is not responsible for these data as a navigational tool.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.2.0.700

dataqual.complete: This dataset was digitized from raster nautical charts. During the digitization process, individual objects may have been omitted inadvertently. This dataset should not be construed to represent all known submarine cables in the vicinity of the main Hawaiian Islands.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal position is accurate to the source nautical chart.

citeinfo.title: Raster Nautical Charts (individual chart names vary)

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Dept. of Commerce, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, National Ocean Service, Coast Survey

srcinfo.srccontr: Dataset was digitized off raster nautical charts.

procstep.procdesc: The raster nautical charts were first reprojected from their original projection/datum to UTM Zone 4, Old Hawaiian using NOAA's Nautical Chart Reprojector v1.8.3. NOAA's ArcView ChartViewer extension was used to display the reprojected nautical charts in ArcView v3.2. Objects were then digitized off the individual nautical charts and merged into a single dataset/shapefile which covers the entire state. The dataset was then transformed to UTM Zone 4, NAD 83, to adhere to new project requirements, using the Hawaii Datums and Projections extension in ArcView.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Source chart from which object was digitized
Secondary source chart from which object was digitized
Description of object as interpreted from the nautical chart symbol
attr.attrdefs: Nautical Chart 1: Nautical Chart Symbols, Abbreviations and Terms, Tenth Ed., Nov. 1997

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

dataIdInfo.idPurp: Submarine cables located in marine waters within the vicinity of the main Hawaiian Islands and recorded on the nautical charts. Source, NOAA raster nautical charts, 2002. Note: June 2024 - Hawaii Statewide GIS Program staff removed extraneous fields that had been added as part of 2016 GIS database conversion and were no longer needed. For additional information, please refer to metadata at https://files.hawaii.gov/dbedt/op/gis/data/cables.pdf or contact Hawaii Statewide GIS Program, Office of Planning and Sustainable Development, State of Hawaii; PO Box 2359, Honolulu, Hi. 96804; (808) 587-2846; email: gis@hawaii.gov; Website: https://planning.hawaii.gov/gis.
dataIdInfo.idAbs: Submarine cables located in marine waters within the vicinity of the main Hawaiian Islands and recorded on the nautical charts. Source, NOAA raster nautical charts, 2002. Note: June 2024 - Hawaii Statewide GIS Program staff removed extraneous fields that had been added as part of 2016 GIS database conversion and were no longer needed. For additional information, please refer to metadata at https://files.hawaii.gov/dbedt/op/gis/data/cables.pdf or contact Hawaii Statewide GIS Program, Office of Planning and Sustainable Development, State of Hawaii; PO Box 2359, Honolulu, Hi. 96804; (808) 587-2846; email: gis@hawaii.gov; Website: https://planning.hawaii.gov/gis.

Consts.useLimit: Data not to be used for navigational purposes. Data were not reviewed or authenticated by the Office of Coast Survey, NOAA National Ocean Service. NOAA is not responsible for these data as a navigational tool.
